alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 6:01PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. Specifically, much of the Owens Valley. * WHEN...Until 600 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM PST, local law enforcement reported flooding ongoing in the warned area. Between 1 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The heavy rain has ended, but flooding will continue for several hours until local drainage can remove the excess water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bishop, Lone Pine, Olancha, Independence, Big Pine, Diaz Lake, Portagee Lake Campground, Tuttle Creek Campground, Keeler, Cartago, Independence Creek Campground, Sawmill Creek Campground, Goodale Creek Campground, Taboose Creek Campground, Tinemaha Campground, Baker Creek Campground, Glacier View Campground, Wilkerson, Browns Town Campground and Millpond Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
